problem_text:
Does there exist a continuum of sets π of primes for which every finite group possessing a Hall π-subgroup is a Dπ-group?
Comment of 2025: It has been proved that, for any integer x, if π is the set of all prime numbers p > x, then any finite group containing a Hall π-subgroup is a Dπ-group (K. A. Ilenko, N. V. Maslova, Siberian Math. J., 62, no. 1 (2021), 44–51).
D. O. Revin
